verses.text: Then he brought me forth into the utter court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that \add was\add* over against the separate place, and which \add was\add* before the building toward the north.
Before the length of an hundred cubits \add was\add* the north door, and the breadth \add was\add* fifty cubits.

Over against the twenty \add cubits\add* which \add were\add* for the inner court, and over against the pavement which \add was\add* for the utter court, \add was\add* gallery against gallery in three \add stories\add*.
And before the chambers \add was\add* a walk of ten cubits breadth inward, a way of one cubit; and their doors toward the north.
Now the upper chambers \add were\add* shorter: for the galleries were higher than these, than the lower, and than the middlemost of the building.

For they \add were\add* in three \add stories\add*, but had not pillars as the pillars of the courts: therefore \add the building\add* was straitened more than the lowest and the middlemost from the ground.
And the wall that \add was\add* without over against the chambers, towards the utter court on the forepart of the chambers, the length thereof \add was\add* fifty cubits.
For the length of the chambers that \add were\add* in the utter court \add was\add* fifty cubits: and lo, before the temple \add were\add* an hundred cubits.
And from under these chambers \add was\add* the entry on the east side, as one goeth into them from the utter court.
The chambers \add were\add* in the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, over against the separate place, and over against the building.

And the way before them \add was\add* like the appearance of the chambers which \add were\add* toward the north, as long as they, \add and\add* as broad as they: and all their goings out \add were\add* both according to their fashions, and according to their doors.

And according to the doors of the chambers that \add were\add* toward the south \add was\add* a door in the head of the way, \add even\add* the way directly before the wall toward the east, as \add one\add* entereth into them.

Then said he unto me, The north chambers \add and\add* the south chambers, which \add are\add* before the separate place, they \add be\add* holy chambers, where the priests that approach unto the \sc Lord\sc* shall eat the most holy \add things:\add* there shall they lay the most holy \add things\add*, and the meat offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place \add is\add* holy.

When the priests enter \add therein\add*, then shall they not go out of the holy \add place\add* into the utter court, but there they shall lay their garments wherein they minister; for they \add are\add* holy; and shall put on other garments, and shall approach to \add those things\add* which \add are\add* for the people.
Now when he had made an end of measuring the inner house, he brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect \add is\add* toward the east, and measured it round about.
He measured the east side with the measuring reed, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
He measured the north side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
He measured the south side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed.
He turned about to the west side, \add and\add* measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
He measured it by the four sides: it had a wall round about, five hundred \add reeds\add* long, and five hundred broad, to make a separation between the sanctuary and the profane \add place\add*.
